text: The iconic Playboy Mansion in all its glory. Peacocks and flamingos wander amongst topiaries celebrating the female form. Two hummingbirds feed off the ‘nipples’ of a pair o topiary breasts.

(singing) "I have no choice, ‘cause I won't say goodbye any more --" A nearby girl wearing an oversize T-shirt hears the song. She drifts toward the music as if in a trance, stripping her shirt to reveal her tiny bikini. SCOTT CAAN does a running cannon-ball into the pool, splashing the girls.

Did we win? EXT. MANSION - POOL —- MOMENTS LATER 4 CLOSE ON a frozen cocktail being poured into a glass. We BACK to see Shelley, now dry, surrounded by adoring MEN a MARVIN, the handsome shirtless butler from before, refill their drinks.

Wow, they taste so much better when you spell it that way. Aren’t these the best Mangoritas guys? The men -- aging lotharios -- grunt in agreement. The COW stares at her boobs.
Not as good as the scenery, but I'll drink ‘em. Shelley looks behind her.

(deeply touched) They’re two years old on Friday. Cassandra comes walking over.

Of course. This is Cassandra she’s only been here a few months, but everybody loves her because she is super beautiful and she never throws up on anyone when she’s drunk. The men all nod in admiration. Cassandra looks disgusted.
So, tell us, Shelley, how does a girl become a Bunny?

Well, when I was a senior in high school, my guidance counselor said he knew the perfect job for me. So he took a picture of me in my bikini and sent it to the magazine. The next thing I knew, I was in LA shaking hands with Hugh Hefner! And he told me I didn't have to live in a foster home anymore. I could live here and have a whole new family! So, here I am.
Are you a centerfold?
(catty) She wishes.
Yeah, I do so cross your fingers, hopefully Hef might give me good news at my birthday party this weekend... (sotto; excited) I have my turn-ons ready and everything.
And what might those be...?
Tanning, giving backrubs, convertibles, and rude people. (beat, then) No, wait, rude people is a turn- off. I’m such a yummy dummy.
True that.
Being a centerfold is the highest, most prestigious honor there is. It says “I’m naked in the middle of the magazine; unfold me.”

I suppose it's kinda like the Nobel “piece of ass” Prize. They laugh hysterically. Shelley looks confused. Potbell puts his arm around her and gives her a squeeze. POTBELLY (CONT’D) (continuing) Well, darlin', seems like you've got a pretty good life here. Shelley beams, dreamily.
It's paradise --
CREDITS ROLL and "BIG PIMPIN'" by Jay Z PLAYS, as a limo pulls up, disgorging a bevy of Bunnies, Shelley happily leading the way.

Decorated with PHOTOS from nine years of Mansion festivit Her BUNNY EARS are on a special shelf, lit like an Oscar. Shelley sleeps, hugging POOTER, her cranky white Himalaya cat. Marvin (shirtless) enters with a breakfast tray.
Your blueberry French Toast is ready, Shelley. He sets them gently on the foot of the bed as she awakens with a happy smile.
Ooh, laa laa... thank you, Marvin. Was that the best party last night or what?
The best. Shelley sees an envelope on her breakfast tray.
What’s that?
It’s from Mr. Hefner.
(excited) It is? It must be my birthday present! Is it finally happening? Am I Miss November? That’s what I wished for when I blew out my candles... (with sudden dread) (MORE )
Oh my G-d! I told you my wish. Now it’s not going to come true! (to envelope) I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to tell!
Just open the envelope. She places the envelope over her heart and shuts her eyes

(continuing) Okay, I'm ready. She opens it and reads aloud. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) "Dear, Shelley --" Oh, my G-d, that's me! "Please move out of the mansion immediately." She frowns, growing concerned, but keeps reading. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) "You have two hours to collect your belongings and leave the premises." (to Marvin) Hef's kicking me out? Why would he do that? This is my home! This is my family! Her big blue eyes fill with tears. Marvin feels bad.
I hate to have to tell you this, but maybe it’s because of your age.
But I'm 27!

Maybe if I just talk to Hef, he'll let me stay.  15 16 10.
Mr. Hefner left for Las Vegas this morning. I don’t think he’s that great with good-byes. Shelley starts to cry.
How bout I make you one last mangorita for old times sake?

Don't worry, Pooter. We'll find a new place to live. It won't have coconut pancakes or poledancing lessons or fireworks on Pamela Lee’s birthday ... but we'll survive. Somehow. Pooter highly doubts this.

That car belongs to the company. This is the car you came here with. He puts her suitcase in the back. She sighs and gets in, starting it. She sees Pooter sitting on the driveway,
C'mon, Pooter. We have to find a new place to live. Pooter doesn’t budge.

I wasn't planning on it, but after tonight, I think I changed my mind.  64.

I change my mind all the time! If you're a Zeta, we can do it together. (to Maria) With pudding! Tanya passes by, thrown over the shoulder of one of the loincloth guys. She calls out to Shelley and Maria.
It’s my turn to get sacrificed. Who would’‘ve thought being a virgin would come in so handy!!! The "native" slaps Tanya on the ass as they pass and moan goofy delight.
Lava! Lava! As the crowd chants The loin-clothed guy carries Tanya up ladder. As people go crazy, Mona notices Ashley and Court approaching.
Hello, ladies. Can I help you?
(scrambling) We just wanted to see how our fellow sisters the Zetas were doing. The crowd erupts in cheers as Tonya gets thrown high in t air for a bellyflop sacrifice. The crowd goes ‘ooh’.

Pretty big splash for a cabbage patch doll. Courtney laughs and holds up her hand for a hi-five. Mona stares at her for a beat and then reaches over and grabs microphone that Maria had earlier. She turns it on.

(over the speakers) Who wants another sacrifice? The crowd goes crazy.  78 65. MONA (CONT’D) It doesn’t sound like you really want it. The crowd goes crazier. MONA (CONT’D) Are these two good enough? She points to Ashley and Courtney who stand there dumbfounded. The crowd goes insane. A group of guys rushe over picks up the two squealing Phi-Mus and starts headin towards the volcano. MONA (CONT’D) (yelling into the mic)

The entire crowd stops and looks at Mona. Dead silent. MONA (CONT’D) We can only sacrifice virgins. Now I’m not sure about these two so I think we should take a vote. Does anyone here think either of these two girls is a virgin? The entire crowd yells “No Way” in unison.
Yeah, me either. Dump ‘em. The guys toss Ashley and Courtney into the baby pool as t whole crowd laughs and points at them. The music kicks ba up and the party rages on.

Ashley and Courtney sit at the dining room table. Ashley eating M&M’s one at a time and looking like crap and Cour is holding an icebag on her breast. The housemother looks impatient as she listens to them moan. The curtains are closed and it is dark and cave like.
I have never been so humiliated.
Everybody laughed at us.  79 66.
I’ve never been laughed at before. The housemother snaps.
Well they’11 be laughing a lot harder when those tramps get more pledges than you. She whips open the curtains and lets the sun in. The girl react.

You’re Phi-Mus for heavens sake. Quit feeling sorry for your selves and fight back. Those losers were inches away from losing their house and now they look like the queens of the campus. Ashley is so upset now she whips an M&M at Courtney’s oth tit. Courtney moans in pain ‘Owwwwww’.
Oliver and Shelley sit at a table for two. Shelley is dre a bit more conservatively than normal, but still sexy.

(mid conversation) ..-And then it was humid so my hair was bushy like Danny Devito’s wife’s underarms. Shelley thinks she has been rambling so she changes the subject. SHELLEY (CONT’D) But I don’t want to bore you with all that girly stuff. So let’s talk about something else. She smiles. Oliver is not what you would call a player so is a little awkward around Shelley’s none too hidden sexuality.
Um, Okay. Who are you gonna vote for?  67.
I’m not sure yet. I just know I won’t listen to what Simon says, he’s so mean. I usually agree with Paula and Randy. Luckily the waiter walks up.
Are we ready to order?
(relieved) Oh yes, Instead of the Mahi Mahi can I just get one Mahi because I’m not that hungry?
Umm, I’1l ask. Oliver looks at her puzzled then orders.
Chicken Marsala for me. The waiter walks away. The two look at each other awkward
Who do think has more nose hair? Donald Trump or Rosie O'Donnell?
Um, I don’t know.

Yeah, me neither. Isn’t that weird? Shelley thinks she's losing him so she tries her "in dema tactic. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Well, I hope they don’t take too long with our food, because I have another date at ten.
Are you serious?
What's a girl to do when she's in demand?  80 81 68. Oliver frowns, less than impressed. Shelly gives a ‘what a hot girl like me do’ smile but has rye bread roll in he front teeth.
The Zetas are hanging with some cute boys. Mona is playin beer pong against a fraternity guy and winning. She sinks another one. The guy drinks it and then starts swaying.
I think we’re going to have to cut you off Ryan.
(slurring) No sweet Mona, I’m doing just fine.
Okay. She winds up and serves a ping pong ball into the guys mo He swallows it.
Shelley and Oliver wait at the valet stand.
So, have fun on your next date.
Oh. I will. Thanks.
Alright, well good-night.
Do you want my number?
It sounds like you’ve got a lot goin' on. Maybe I'll just see you at the nursing home sometime. He walks off.

(in baby talk voice) Wait -- your biceps are huge! Kiss me!  82 69. He gives her a weird look, waves goodbye and keeps going. Shelley stands there, forlorn. The valet hands her the ke SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) I screwed up, didn't I?

Si. But I will kiss you with my man tongue if that’s any consolation. The valet sticks his tongue out and it has a tatoo of the words MAN TONGUE on it. Shelley fakes like she’s getting cell phone call from her fake brother Steven Segal. The v puts his tongue back in.
The girls are all hanging out and they can’t wait to hear details. Shelley enters, bummed out about her date.
How'd it go, Shell?
Not good. I don't think he likes me. He didn’t even try to do it with me in the mens room.
Why do you think he didn’t like you?
I could just tell. He didn’t fall for any of my tricks.
Maybe he’s one of those guys that wants to have an intelligent conversation with a girl before he hooks up with her?
What? No...... Really?..... So I have to get smart? Can I even do that? All the girls give her encouraging looks.
Piles of textbooks on shelves and tables. Shelley emerges with an armful of US magazines.
I usually get all my world news from US Magazine.
How about you try this one. She holds up an issue of ‘U.S. News and World Report’.

Us news and world report? Does it have celebrity pictures and gossip from other countries, too? Maria begrudgingly smiles and opens the paper to a pictur a skinny starving African man with flies on him. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Is that Chris Rock? He’s looking totally manarexic. Maria is baffled.

Shelley sits next to Tonya in an architecture class. The PROFESSOR flips through SLIDES of different buildings and drones on. Shelley takes all this in as best she can. Pay complete attention. Shelley looks to her left and now doe see Tonya. The camera pans down and we see Tonya curled u asleep under Shelley’s chair like the adorable little per she is. Shelley pets her and keeps on learning.

Shelley is talking into Lilly’s closet. Lilly pokes her scarf covered head out. Shelley leads her out across the room and out onto the front yard. She looks peaceful and control. The two even start talking about English history From the other side of the yard, the mailman appears and tries to hand her the mail. She freaks out and runs back inside.  86 87 71. INT. MARIA’S ROOM - DAY 86 There is a chart on the wall that says “Intelligent Conversation Topics”. It has headings that say, Literatur Art, History, etc.. Shelley is sitting on the bed. Harmon sitting opposite her pretending to be Oliver(she is dress like a man and wearing a wig).
So what did you do today, Shelley?

Well Oliver, I was dripping hot wax on my ta-tas so I could see my tolerance for pain. Maria gives her a dirty look. Shelley reads off of the no card in her hand. SHELLEY (CONT’D) I mean watched the O’Reilly Factor. Maria and Harmony give a ‘that’s better’ look.
Joanne is standing in front of the mirror. She is holding cute tropical outfit up in front of her. She is wearing h usual clothes that cover her brace. Shelley walks in and stands behind her.
That’s such a cute outfit.
Too bad I can never wear it.
When do you get to take the brace off?
(excitedly) Well it’s a good thing I asked!
I don’t want to take it off I’m used to it.  88 72. Joanne runs to her bed and gets under the covers quickly. Shelly approaches her very motherly.

You know Joanne, when I was little, I wore a Scooby Doo mask to school for a whole month because I thought I was ugly. Every single day... Then one day a boy, Howard Rebenstock, snuck up from behind me and just tore it off my face. And do you know what I realized?
That you were pretty?
No, that I’d been wearing it upside down.
I’m not really sure what you're trying to tell me.
I don’t either but you’re a butterfly now,not an earthworm! You don’t need to hide anymore. Joanne looks unsure.

He jogs by here around this time every day. You like him. You want to talk to him. Today is your day. (noticing) Here he comes. The cute guy jogs by the house. Joanne just freezes. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Come on Joanne, say something to him. Spread your wings, butterfly. Joanne goes to say something but she can’t. SHELLEY (CONT’D) He’s getting away! You can do this! You know why? (MORE )
SHELLEY (CONT’D) Because you’re a smart, beautiful, confident woman. And no matter what, I love you.
You do?
One hundred and fifty percent.
You're the best Shelley. I love you, too. The girls look at each other sweetly. Then Joanne looks a sees her guy has run past the house and is getting away.
Go get him! Joanne takes off running after her guy. We see her legs going, faster and faster.
Run Joanne, run! And then, in SLOW MOTION, her brace starts to break into pieces and fall off her body just like FORREST GUMP. Joan catches the guy and runs along side him.
Hi Steve.
Hey Joanne. I didn’t know you ran.
I do now. Back on the lawn, Shelley watches proudly. Then, her mome of bliss is BROKEN by
You're pretty pleased with yourself, aren’t you?
What? Yes, I guess I am.  89 74.

Well don’t get used to that feeling, because there is no way I’m going to let a whorey little tart like you stand in the way of the Phi Mu’s taking the Zeta house. Shelley is shocked. Then, her gaze goes toward a birthmar on the Phi Mu Housemother’s neck.
What’s that thing on your neck?
It’s a mole!
A mole? It looks more like a pUppy-
You’ve been warned. Don’t mess with me. Don’t mess with Phi Mu. She walks off.
Boy, someone needs a smoothie with an extra vita boost.
Shelley, in a boxy cardigan, a denim knee-length skirt an clogs looks in the mirror. She is wearing no makeup and h hair is pulled back. She is dismayed.
But, you can't even tell I have boobs!
Come on, you gave us alla makeover, it’s our turn to give you one. Nothing against your previous... ‘boyfriends’, but Oliver is the kind of guy that wants a girl to look smart. Trust me.
I do trust you.  90 75.
Your head is still too sexy. You might need to wear my glasses. Shelley takes them with a sigh.
It'll be good. Oliver is not the type of guy that wants boobs over brains.
Okay, so I shouldn’t stand on my head. Maria laughs. So does Shelley but she doesn’t know why.
As some girls read to the older folks, Harmony leads the other old folks in a yoga class. Beatrice is trying to to her toes but can’t bend past her knees.
When I was younger I could put my feet behind my head.
No one finds that surprising. Francis sits talking to Shelley. We only see Shelly from behind.
I don’t know about all that but I sure do sweat a lot at night. Oliver walks by, hearing this.
What's going on? Shelley turns around, wearing her frumpy outfit, eyes BUL through Maria's coke-bottle glasses.
Shelley?  91 76.

Oh, hello Oliver. We're discussing global warming. An area of particular interest to me. Perhaps if it's of interest to you, we could go get a cup of coffee and talk about it? Oliver takes in the new Shelley.
Uh, yeah, I guess. Unless you've got another date later.
I'm free for the entire evening. (to Francis) Sorry Francis can we continue this discussion later?
Better be soon. I'm old. Oliver checks out Shelley’s new outfit as they walk out.
Shelley and Oliver drink their coffee. Shelley has taken Maria's glasses.
Well, I've never heard it put that way, but you're right -- Kim Jong Il is super mean.
And there's some bad people in the Middle East who are doing some bad things, too, and I don’t think that’s right.
Sounds like you've been reading the paper. Shelley nods.
The girls have it delivered right to the house. Every morning.  77.
You really click with those girls don’t you?.
They're my new family.
What happened to your old one?
Unfortunately, they didn’t want me around anymore.
Wow. That’s terrible. Shelley thinks a moment.
When I was little, one of my foster moms had a coffee cup that said, "Life is a shit sandwich, but you don't have to take a bite." And I've tried to live by those words ever since.
Well -- I guess it works because you're definitely the most upbeat person I've ever met. Shelley smiles at him, touched. It's the first time a man ever complimented her for anything but her looks.
So, what did your mom's coffee cup say?
I think it was, "Leave me alone. I'm busy chain-smoking."
Well, at least she had a hobby.
See? Upbeat. The waiter comes over and starts clearing the table
Would you care for any desert?  92 78. He looks at Shelley and a light goes off in his head.
Wait a minute -- this is gonna sound weird, but were you ever in Playboy? Oliver takes umbrage at this.
Whoa -- excuse me, pal. That’s a little insulting. Are you calling my date a bimbo? Shelley looks at him, knowing now what he would think of if he knew the truth.
No, of course not. I'm sorry, ma'am. I was out of line.
Oh, it's okay -- I'm sure whichever -- "bimbo" -- was in that issue is really pleased that you remember her. He leaves.
I should have popped that jerk. Playboy. Gimme a break.
Yeah, those girls are all boobs and no brains. I like to think of myself as all brains and medium boobs. Oliver smiles; Shelley forces a smile through her disappointment.
Shelley enters, shutting the door behind her. Maria and t other girls look over from the living room.
(continuing) So? What happened?  93 79.
Did you talk about the situation in Sri Lanka?
Did you get to use "parsimonious" in a sentence?
Who cares? Did you guys do it?
(defeated) Uh, no.
What? Why not?
It just... isn’t going to work out.
Oh, but I was hoping we could both lose our virginity in the same semester.
(frozen smile) Yeah...

Hef sits on his bed eating ice cream out of the carton. A of the curtains are closed. Holly, Bridget, Kendra and Cassandra try to rouse him from his depression. Marvin br in a new carton and switches it out.
C’mon puffin. You’ve been in here for days now.
Yeah, Hef. Let’s have movie night. It'll cheer you up.
Why would she just leave?
It’s for the best. She wasn’t happy.  80.
Really?
How do you know? What did she tell you? Marvin looks terrified as he quickly exits. Cassandra lie without missing a beat.
She never told me anything, but I used to hear her crying in her room late at night. Hef shakes his head sadly at this.
I think I’d like to be alone for a bit.
Sure, Hef. The girls all get up slowly.
(bummed out) I guess we can have another pillow fight in my room.
(equally bummed) I’1ll go get the whipped cream. The girls all exit, on the way out Cassandra shoots Marvi look.
Marvin, I'd like to do some editing work on the website. Could you put it up on my computer please?
Yes, sir. Marvin heads for the computer room. He pauses, looks at H gets an idea, then exits to the computer room..  94 95 81.

It’s empty. Hef enters, sits and looks at the screen. He gets a puzzled look on his face. We see THE SCREEN. Marvi has put the ZETA WEBSITE up. Next to a banner that says ‘click here for our Aztec Party Photos’ is a cartoon body a girl with SHELLEY’S HEAD on it. Hef’s face brightens.
My Shelly?
The girls are all gathered in the living room for Bid Nig

Okay, guys. So like everybody on campus wants to be a Zeta now. But unfortunately we can only have thirty. So let’s figure out who they are going to be. Hit it Carrie. Carrie starts the slide show. The first girl comes up. Cute blonde. Looks very new Zeta.
Kristin Withers. Pre-med. Family from Greenwich. Everyone?
Yeah, yeah, etc Next slide. Another cute blonde.
Jill Palmer, from Colorado. Theater major. Father owns Coors.
Yeah, yeah, etc. Next slide. Dark haired girl. Still cute.
Allison Jackson. English major. From Florida. Has a Porsche. Everyone met her right?
Yeah, yeah. She’s good.  96 82.
Are you guys sure?
What’s wrong?
Well, we’ve sort of achieved an image here, and to be honest I don’t know if this girl fits in. She seemed kind of weird. She was eating our cake with her fingers.
I saw her watching Iron Chef during the party.
You see? Kind of socially awkward and brunette.
Yeah, yeah, dump her. Forget it. The phone in the kitchen rings. Someone comes back and sa it’s for Shelley. Shelley exits.
Shelley picks up the phone.
Hello?
Is this my darling Shelley?
Hef?
Oh thank heavens. I’m so glad we found you.
I can’t believe I’m hearing your voice. I’ve totally missed you and I’m so sorry for whatever I did.
What you did?  83.
Yeah. Marvin gave me the birthday card you wrote...
Next slide is a meeker girl with thick glasses.
Katootoo Jihiman. Sociology. From India. Everyone?
Could those glasses be any thicker?
Yeah, and hair conditioner called, it wants to know why you won’t use it.
Not up to Zeta standards.
No way. Nah. Next. Lilly peaks her head out of her door. Next slide. A little person. Looks good other than that.
Jodi Taylor. Film school. New Mexico. Everyone?
(noticing Tonya) She’s okay. I guess. Yeah, yeah.
Hey, don’t look at me. I thought she was weird. All she talked about was Justin Timberlake and her pet lizard.
(relieved) Phewwww, thanks. We agree....
Look at you people! Is this really what you have become? (MORE )

Judging other girls on their appearance, calling them ‘weird’? I’m sure glad I joined when I did because I probably wouldn’t make the cut these days. And neither would a lot of you. I can’t believe that Zeta has become just like Phi Mu. A bunch of snooty bitches! Lilly gets so self conscience that she finally spoke that bolts toward the window and dives out. Everyone stares at each other. She was right about what she said. Silence.
Shelley on phone, much happier.
It was bad information you received, Shelly, and to prove it to you darling, I want you to be the March centerfold. Shelley’s eyes go wide.
Oh my g-d! Hef, that is so awesome. I can’t believe it!.

Believe it. And I want you to move back to the Mansion. It’s just not the same without you. Shelley's smile is gigantic but she notices things around kitchen that remind her of her new family, a Zeta calenda the wall, pictures from the Aztec party and the nursing h with Oliver in front are on the fridge. Hef keeps talking but we don’t hear what he is saying anymore. Shelley is having second thoughts.
I’m so sorry Hef. I love you, but I can’t do it. I just can’t. I’ve started a new family and I’m gonna stay here with them.
The girls are still sitting in silence.
Oh my G-D. What have we become?
It all started with this fake blonde hair. And these stupid water bras. We’re just a bunch of clones. Completely interchangeable.
Shelley hangs up the phone and starts back to the living room. Just as she reaches the door she hears Mona talking and stops. INT. ZETA LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS 101
This is all Shelley's fault. Before she got here we were individuals she’s turned us into stupid bunnies. We’d be so much better off if she had never came into our lives.
Shelley. Shocked. Hurt. A tear. She quickly runs back to her room unnoticed. INT. ZETA LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS 103

You’re right about us. But you are wrong about Shelley. She is the best thing that ever happened to this place. She didn’t just change our outward appearance. She changed our attitudes. We can throw parties now. Heck, I may even have a boyfriend for the first time in my life. (MORE )
And Mona, you no longer have a that stupid bone going through your nose. Everyone agrees that is a good one. Lilly coming back in house.
And she got me to talk. Everyone agrees, happily.
And she freed me from my fears. More agreement.
You’re right. I just think we need to tone it down a little. Be more of who we were.
Yeah. Good idea.
It will be the perfect mix. Half Shelley. Half us.
Where is Shelley, anyway?
In the kitchen. Hey Shelley! She doesn’t answer. They all go to the kitchen.
Shelley is gone.
Shelley sits in her car. Crying. Writing a letter. She looks at the picture of Pooter hanging from her rearview mirror.
I can’t be myself with Oliver, and I tried to turn the girls into something they don’t want to be. (MORE )
Well Pooter, I guess all I am is just a dumb bunny.

Shelley's car pulls up. She gets out and approaches the f door. She takes out an envelope, we see the name ‘Oliver’ it. She drops it through the mail slot and heads back to car and drives off. INT. SHELLEY’S CAR 107 Shelley drives the windy Sunset Boulevard. Her cellphone rings, she answers.
Hello?
Shelley, it’s Maria. Where are you?
I’m moving back to the mansion. Hef called last night and said he wanted me to be the March centerfold.
(trying to be happy) Oh, wow. Congratulations. That’s awesome.
Yeah, it’s what I always wanted. So....
So good. Good. Great. All your dreams are finally coming true.

Yeah, I guess they are. You guys have a great rush, I’m sure you’ll get a million new pledges. Tell everyone I said goodbye. Shelley hangs up. Maria is confused, something doesn’t se right...  108 109 88.
MUSIC plays as a MONTAGE BEGINS. Joanne, Mona and Becky o again have their heads in the sinks as stylists attend to them. Harmony, Tanya and Carrie Mae are under the dryer.
Well, whatever we're gonna be, we need to figure it out. We still need 30 girls by Oct. 15th, or we can kiss it all goodbye.
When we show these girls who we really are I don’t think we’1ll have any problems. Right?
Shelley pulls in to a hero’s welcome. She is almost enjoy it. We see Cassandra walking down the driveway with Marvi carrying her luggage.
Oliver opens a letter. Its the one Shelley was writing. W hear his voice reading it over the rest of the montage.

I am sorry I couldn’t tell you this in person. It was way too embarrassing to face you after all we've been through. I’m leaving the Zeta house to fulfill my life long dream. And I know that it won’t make any sense to you. I’m going to work in the Peace Corps in the mountains of Peru.

Joanne and Carrie Mae, now brunette again, stand alongsid Mona who is still blonde, but with a more punk rock haird and a defiant stripe of blue. They hand out ZETA LOLLIPOP while Harmony strums her guitar.  112 113 114 89.

The cat jumps into Shelley’s arms. Shelley smiles and hol the cat up to her face for a kiss. Then with an even bigg smile on her face, walks over and places the cat inside t dog fence. The dogs start chasing her all around.
Harmony, now make-up free, pokes holes in her water bra w a steak knife and waters the rosebushes. Behind her, Mari and Joanne hang a Rush banner that reads: "ZETA: BE WHO Y WANNA BE".
Oliver finishes the letter. Looks confused.
Shelley is ready for bed, talking to Marvin.
.--. and that’s when I overheard the girls talking about me. I thought they’d be better off without me so... here I am.
I don’t know Shelley, it sounds like they were better off with you.

I guess not. And you know what really sucks is for the first time in my life, I really felt like people liked me for what I had to say. I was even going to sign up for some night classes next semester so I could come up with even smarter things to say to people but I guess that would be stupid now. This hits Marvin.  90. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Anyway, good night Marvin. It’s great to talk to you again.
It sure is Shelly. Good night. Marvin goes to exit, pausing at the door for a moment to at Shelley rolling over sadly to go to sleep. Then he exi
Maria is holding court. The other Zetas are talking to rushees on the lawn. They all have a confidence and enthusiasm that wasn’t there before.
Zeta was founded on the tenets of sisterhood, friendship and philanthropy. Since then we’ve added kick ass parties to the list. Joanne is talking to some girls by the front steps.
There really isn’t a Zeta type. We’re open to all girls who are looking for something different. That’s why our rush theme is “Be who you want to be”.
Zeta's still totally my first choice.
Me, too. Maria smiles.
Lilly walks across the quad. She has all the pledge bids her hands. There must be about 100 of them.
Lilly walks up to the counter. The clerk is on the phone, shuffling through some papers. There is a cute guy standi there who notices her.  gl.
Hi. Are you new on campus? I don’t think we’ve ever met. My name is Cole. Lilly puts the invites down on the counter and fixes her hair.

I just...transferred. My name is Lilly. Ashley walks in to drop off her bids. She sees Lilly is i deep conversation. She sees Lilly’s envelopes. While the clerk is still turned around, she acts quickly and slides them into the nearby garbage can. The clerk finishes his phone call. Ashley hands her invites to him.
She just dropped these on the floor. Can you send them out for her?
Sure thing. Ashley exits. Lilly turns around. Notices the invites are missing. Starts to freak.
What happened to all those invites??
I got ‘em. Don’t worry.
Pheww. You scared me.
Shelley is looking at old party photos on the wall. She i about to be part of history. She pauses at one for a beat longer than the rest.
(shaking her head) Nah. No way. The Playboy EDITOR appears behind her. He pulls out a cha for her.  92.
(continuing) So let's get started on your centerfold interview. Shelley sits. He smiles at her.
Let’s start with ambitions.
Well my ambition was to be a centerfold.
So all your dreams have come true. Shelley nods, halfheartedly.
Yeah...I guess so.
Guilty pleasure?
Eating cookie dough with my best friend Maria... who secretly hates me. He takes notes.
We'll just change "who hates me" to "in the nude". He makes a note on his papers.
Okay, hit me with your turn-ons.
(wistful) Someone who's kind and sweet to old people. A bad dancer. And guys whose first name begins with 0.
(sarcastic) Wow. That's hot. Turn offs? Shelley thinks for a moment.  120 121 93.
Cauliflower, global warming, and misogyny.
Let's just change "misogyny" to “mean people”.
It’s all decked out. Furniture moved to the sides of the room. They are ready for the 100 girls to show up. Our girls look really nice, and are just waiting around. Mona walks in with a huge bowl.
This should be big enough to hold everyone’s name.
I bet we're the first sorority to pick their pledges by drawing names out of a bowl.
This way we don’t have to judge people. The first 30 girls picked get the bids.
All the girls are so nice. Maybe I’1l move out so we can pick 31.
I could move out or we might only be able to pick 29.
If there is a shy pledge, she can have my closet. Mona is looking out the front door.
Hey check this out.
All the rushees are piling into the other houses. No one coming to Zeta.  122 94. Ashley and Courtney welcome their huge throng.
What the hell?
Do you think everyone changed their minds?
You did send out the invitations, didn’t you Lilly?
Absolutely.

head_text.subj: TYLER HANDS HER HIS PHONE NUMBER
SHE SMILES AND PUTS IT IN HER PURSE

text: Guys...Ashley must have stolen them. She was there when I was there. And there was this boy there. And I never talked to one before. And I got his phone number. And, and, and...
That bitch. Time for her to get cut. Mona opens her switchblade. Everyone is ready to kill.  123 124 95.
The girls burst out of the house and head for Phi Mu. Mon is the first one there, getting in Ashley's face.
You couldn’t beat us so you had to pull this crap.
What? There is general hub bub and name calling amongst the two sororities finally the Phi Mu housemother steps in.
Girls. Girls. Girls. Where is your spirit of sisterhood? This should be a great day. Inviting others to join us as sisters for life.
(pointing to Ashley) She stole our bids.
I don’t have any idea what you are talking about.

Now, we had a deal. And it appears that you have not fulfilled it. So Monday Zeta will appear in front of the Pan-Hellenic council to have their charter revoked. If you have any evidence of your charges against Ashley you can present it there. The Zetas look devastated as they head back to their hous The Phi-Mus wave goodbye and fake like they are wiping aw tears as they head back inside.

Shelley is getting ready to shoot her centerfold. She has chosen the library as her setting. She is posing next to of the bookshelves with a cart full of books. She is not nude but she is very skimpily dressed. There is a person a fog machine and a person with a wind machine. Everyone bustling around. Shelley looks distracted.  96.
We need more fog! The guy cranks up the machine a little and a cloud of smo envelopes Shelley.
(coughing) Why would there be fog in a library?
It’s sexy. Who knows maybe someone is smoking. Maria enters.
Or maybe it’s because your butt is smoking hot.

(excited for the first time) Maria! What are you doing here? They run to each other and hug. While Maria and Shelley a talking, various hair, make-up people and clothing stylis work on Shelley like a Nascar pit crew. Going as far as flossing her teeth.
I came to straighten out the mix up about what you overheard the girls saying about you.
How do you know about that?
Well, let’s just say a little bird told me. Maria looks to the door, Marvin is standing there smiling Maria looks back to Shelley.
What bird? Maria and Marvin react, Marvin walks over and stands righ next to Maria.  125 97.
Shelley, Marvin called me and said you told him everything that happened. It was alla misunderstanding so I came right over.

But I heard what you guys said about. Everyone thinks I ruined Zeta. Mona said I turned you all into a bunch of dumb bunnies. OUCH! One of the pit crew has plucked an unwanted hair from Shelley’s butt with a pair of tweezers and holds it up proudly. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Could I have five minutes guys. Everyone walks away as Shelley puts on a robe and leads M to a different room.
The girls enter the room which is adorned with old photos the wall.

Mona was just talking about our hair and the way we were dressing. Maybe we did go a little to far. But everybody loves you. For the next ten minutes we all talked about how you were the best thing that ever happened to us. The house just isn’t the same without you. Shelley’s eyes well up a bit at this news.
Really?
Of course. You’re the best housemother any sorority has ever seen. They hug.  126 98.
Oh my G-d, I have to thank Marvin. And where’s that big bird, I’d like to thank it, too.
Shelley, forget about the -- I will pass on your thanks to the bird.
(breaking the hug) So what happened with rush?
Well, we had tons of girls interested, but no one showed up because Ashley stole our bids. We have no proof but she did.
So the house is gone?

Yeah. We’re supposed to go in front of the Pan-Hellenic council on Monday to make it official but I don’t think any of us are even going to show up. We been humiliated enough in our lives. Shelley looks at the old PHOTOS on the wall of Hef and hi exploits throughout the years. She stops in front of the she was staring at before and pulls it off the wall.
Maybe someone else does.

A large auditorium style classroom. It is filled with sorority and fraternity types. There is a table at the fr with Ashley and a couple of other “Greek” leaders. There also a large screen and a projection system. Mrs. Hagstro and Mr. Walker, her fraternity counterpart, are obviously running things.
So the new goal for fund-raising next semester is two thousand dollars per house. (MORE )
Anyone coming in above that will be honored in our yearly banquet. All those in favor say aye.
Aye. On the big screen the group shot from the Zeta’s appears.

Now, our last order of business. Unfortunately, not all of us will be here next year. Shelley and all the girls enter at the back of the auditorium. MRS. HAGSTROM (CONT’D) For the fifth year in a row the Zeta’s did not fulfill their rush requirements so they will be de- certified and their house put up for sale. All those in favor say..... Shelley makes her way down the center aisle. Everyone hub bubs.
Not so fast. I have one piece of business that I think everyone will want to see, before you get to your piece.

Please Miss Darlington, you are not a housemother anymore. You don’t even have a house. This fine institution of higher learning will be much better off without a band of misfits led by a wanna be porn star. This institution is and always will be hose bag free.

I couldn’t have said it better myself. The crowd...huh, what? Carrie Mae gets the guy running th projector in a headlock and Mona drops in the slide. It i picture of Hef from Woodstock. He is standing next to a v muddy, very naked, very hairy hippy. On closer examinatio see that it is a young Mrs. Hagstrom and she is grabbing Hef’s crotch. The crowd bursts into heated conversation.  100. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Are these the type of values we would like to promote Mrs. Hagstrom?
That is not me!

Then I guess there must be two people who have a freaky mole on their neck that looks like a puppy. Mona drops another slide in and we see that it is a close of the mole on the hippy’s neck. Mrs. Hagstrom covers her neck and starts to stutter.
But... I mean... It was The Sixties. (she goes for the projector) You can’t blame me I was shrooming. The hubbubs go crazy. Mr. Walker bangs a gavel on the tab to get everyone to calm down.

While this is without a doubt the most interesting meeting I’ve been to in a while, I think it is time to resolve these issues and move on. So here is how it is going to work. We’re all going to start over. Mrs. Hagstrom, you’re gonna tone it down and act like a human being again from now on with or without the assistance of mushrooms. Mrs. Hagstrom nods in agreement.
As for the girls of Phi-Mu, I wish I could put you on probation for being mean and nasty people but I can’t so I will just tell you, try to be less bitchy. The girls are shocked.
You heard me.  127 101. He turns to the Zeta’s.

And that brings us to the Zeta’s, you’re going to keep your house, your dignity, and your self esteem, but maybe you could shave your legs every once in a while? The Zeta’s nod in agreement then celebrate, all gathering around Shelley and hugging her.
But next year you will get enough pledges and meet all the other requirements or we will be back here.
Yes sir! Ashley walks over and angrily whispers to Mrs. Hagstrom.
And you yelled at me for wearing open toed shoes! The Beer Pong Dude stands up.
Can we get a copy of that picture?
It’s all yours. Mona flings it out into the crowd.
Great. I’m gonna post it on www.need-a-trim.com. Everyone laughs except Mrs. Hagstrom.
The girls all enter the house. Everyone is celebrating th victory.
That was awesome Shelley. You saved us again.  128 102.
Hef and Marvin get a lot of the credit, too.
This is so great. Everything worked out perfectly.
Well, not perfectly. Real perfection would be me and Oliver together right now. But that can never be cause I moved to Peru and only left him a note.
But you didn’t really move to Peru.
I know that but he doesn’t. Shelley walks towards the kitchen a little dejected.
As Shelley enters she sees Oliver standing under a banner that says “Welcome Back from Peru Shelley”. He is holding bouquet of flowers. Shelley shyly walks over to him. All girls enter now.
How did you know I was back from Peru?
A little bird told me.
I got to meet this freakin bird and take him to dinner or something.
Me. I’m the bird. I called Oliver up the minute I found out you were upset. Shelley is touched. She puts her hands over her heart.
(to Maria) This is what it must feel like to have a best friend. (MORE )
(to Oliver) Now I have to admit something to you. I didn’t go to Peru.
Get out of here. Everyone in the room laughs.
Also, I was in Playboy.

I know, Shelly. And I have something to admit to you. I was totally wrong about saying girls in Playboy are bimbos. Because you are the sweetest, funniest, most caring and generous girl I’ve ever met in my life, not to mention your incredible brain and medium boobs.
So... you’ll be my boyfriend?
Heck yeah. I mean how many guys who manage a nursing home get to say they have a Playmate Centerfold for a girlfriend?
Actually I left before we did the photo shoot. But if you have a camera I can be your personal private centerfold.

(yelling) Does anyone have a camera I can borrow right now?!! I’1l give you everything I own!!!!!!!! Shelley laughs as Oliver pulls her in for a kiss. We see the girls peeking in at the kitchen door. Everyone oooohh and ahhhs. We hear a knock on the back door. The girls wa into the kitchen.
Shelley, it’s for you. Marvin enters the room, still shirtless, carrying a suitc  104.
Marvin, what are you doing here?

I’ve been hired as the Zeta House’s new butler. Since you'll be taking classes next semester, you'll need someone to help out around here. Oh, and Hef wanted me to let you know that the Zetas have a lifetime pass into the mansion. The girls all react, psyched.
Marvin, I guess all I can say is... welcome to my new family!
Ladies. I am at your disposal.
Disposal. Right. I think the garbage disposal is broken. After you fix that we’ll take some mangoritas on the front porch.
Not a problem. All the girls come in for a group hug as we fade.
UNDER CREDITS we see a rockin’ ZETA HOUSEPARTY including

head_text.subj: SHELLEY, OLIVER AND ALL THE RESIDENTS OF THE NURSING HOME

text: partying with the Zetas and other students.
